member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.HostObject.Address
member.summary: This field is required. Address of the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.HostObject.Port
member.summary: This field is optional. Port used by the host service to test. Set to zero to use the default for the end point type.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.HostObject.Timeout
member.summary: This field is optional. The timeout in milliseconds to be used when testing this host service. The default is not included is to set the timeout to 10000 ms.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.QuantumHostObject.Address
member.summary: This field is required. Address of the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.QuantumHostObject.Port
member.summary: This field is optional. Port used by the host service to test. Set to zero to use the default for the end point type.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.QuantumHostObject.Timeout
member.summary: This field is optional. The timeout in milliseconds to be used when testing this host service. The default is not included is to set the timeout to 10000 ms.

member.name: T:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery
member.summary: Query parameters for fetching PingInfo data by date range and MonitorPingInfo.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery.MonitorIPID
member.summary: MonitorIPID or Host ID to filter PingInfos by.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery.MonitorPingInfoID
member.summary: MonitorPingInfoID to filter PingInfos by.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery.Address
member.summary: Address to filter PingInfos by.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery.StartDate
member.summary: Start date for the range filter. This is assumed to be UTC. Will be converted to integer for querying.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery.EndDate
member.summary: End date for the range filter. This is assumed to be UTC. Will be converted to integer for querying.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.DateRangeQuery.User
member.summary: The user making the query.

members.member: This field is required. The prompt that was entered by the user. The backend will use this to assist in creating a useful reponse for the user.

member.name: T:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost
member.summary: This class holds data that is used to edit hosts.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.EditAuthKey
member.summary: This is a string that is used to authenticate the Edit action for non authorised users. This key is returned when adding a host for the first time (IsEdit=false). It should be stored and sent with subsequent edit requests. Note authenticated users do not need this.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.AddUserEmail
member.summary: If the user is default then AddUserEmail is used to identify different users. If the user is authenticated this field is not necessary.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.UserID
member.summary: The userId of the user editing the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.MonitorIPID
member.summary: This is the host ID used for identifying the host actions on the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetEnabled
member.summary: On editting set the Enabled field.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetAddress
member.summary: On editting set the host address and hostname of the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetEndPointType
member.summary: On Editting set the end point type. Example : http is a website ping, https is a ssl certificate check, httphtml is a website html load, icmp is a host ping, dns is a dns lookup, smtp is an email server helo message confirmation, quantum is a quantum safe encryption test, rawconnect is a low level raw socket connection.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetPort
member.summary: On editting set the port of the service being monitored on edit. It should be zero if it is the standard port for the host end point type.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetTimeout
member.summary: On editting set the time to wait for a timeout in milliseconds. If a timeout occurs the host is considered to be down or the test has failed.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetHidden
member.summary: On editting set if the host is hidden. Setting this to true effectively deletes the host from future monitoring. Historic data will still be available on the web interface.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetUsername
member.summary: On editting set the authentication username for connection to the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetPassword
member.summary: On editting set the authentication password for connection to the host.

members.member: This field is required. The prompt that was entered by the user. The backend will use this to assist in creating a useful reponse for the user.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetAppID
member.summary: Set the Agent ID (AppID) . For internet monitors this can be 1 for agent located at London - UK , 2 for Kansas - USA, 3 for Berlin - Germany. If it is a local agent then the AppID will be the same as UserInfo.UserID .

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.EditHost.SetAgentLocation
member.summary: Set The monitoring agents location for the host. The format is 'City - Country' for internet based agents. For local agents the format is 'emailaddress - agentid'.

member.name: F:NetworkMonitor.Objects.Factory.EndPointTypeFactory.ResponseTimeThresholds
member.summary: Dictionary of values for the response time thresholds that are considered to be either excellent , good or fair. there are two sets because the port zero can do more work for some endpoint types (nmap).

member.name: T:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP
member.summary: This class contains information about a host being monitored. Show the actual data do not anonymise this data. Sensitive fields have been filtered.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Enabled
member.summary: Is monitoring for the host enabled.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Address
member.summary: The host address and hostname of the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.EndPointType
member.summary: The endpoint type. Endpoint types are: quantum is a quantum safe encryption test, http is a website ping, https is an SSL certificate check, httphtml is a website HTML load, icmp is a host ping, dns is a DNS lookup, smtp is an email server helo message confirmation, rawconnect is a low-level raw socket connection, nmap is a nmap service scan of the host, nmapvuln is a nmap vulnerability scan of the host and crawlsite performs a simulated user crawl of the site that generates site traffic using chrome browser.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Port
member.summary: The port of the service being monitored. It will be zero if it is the standard port for the host end point type.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Timeout
member.summary: The time to wait for a timeout in milliseconds. If a timeout occurs the host is considered to be down or the test has failed.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.UserID
member.summary: The user that has added this host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Hidden
member.summary: Is the host hidden. Ie it should no longer be visible or be being monitored.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.AppID
member.summary: The Monitoring agent ID. For internet monitors this can be 1 for agent located at London - UK , 2 for Kansas - USA, 3 for Berlin - Germany. If it is a local agent then it will be the same as the user id .

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Username
member.summary: Username used for authenticatin the service on the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.Password
member.summary: Username used for authenticatin the service on the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.AddUserEmail
member.summary: When the host is down alerts are sent to this email address. When adding hosts every host must have an email address assigned to it. The email address along a valid EditAuthKey identifies the user and allows them to edit hosts they add.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.IsEmailVerified
member.summary: Has the User Email been verified. Verifying an email address verifies all hosts associated with that email address.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.EditAuthKey
member.summary: This Authorization key is used to check if an Api request has the authority to edit hosts associated with a single email address. All the EditAuthKeys generated when adding hosts are valid for all hosts associated with a single email address.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.MessageForUser
member.summary: This message should be displayed to the user. It will contain addtional information about the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.DateAdded
member.summary: Date host was added.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIP.AgentLocation
member.summary: The location of the monitoring agent for this host.

member.name: T:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery
member.summary: Query parameters for retreiving host config. ONLY USE THIS QUERY FOR HOST CONFIG NOT FOR ACTUAL MONITORING DATA. Only none null fields are used in query

members.member: This field is Required .The prompt that was entered by the user. The backend will use this to assist in creating a useful reponse for the user.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.EditAuthKey
member.summary: The Edit Auth Key used to save and edit host data non authenticated users.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.MonitorIPID
member.summary: Host config data is contained in MonitorIP. This is the ID field for a MonitorIP.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.AddUserEmail
member.summary: Only return hosts that are associated with this email address.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.PageSize
member.summary: Paginate the data when the data returned is large or can not all be displayed to the user. Set the maximum number of results per page to be returned.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.PageNumber
member.summary: Paginate the data when the data returned is large or can not all be displayed to the. Use the PageNumber to return a page of data. ///

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.Enabled
member.summary: Is this host enabled.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.Address
member.summary: Address or URI of the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.Port
member.summary: The port the host is using.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.EndPointType
member.summary: The end point type. Example : http is a website ping, https is a ssl certificate check, httphtml is a website html load, icmp is a host ping, dns is a dns lookup, smtp is a email server helo message confirmation, quantum is a quantum safe encryption test.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.AgentLocation
member.summary: The monitoring agents location for the host. The format is 'City - Country' for internet based agents. For local agents the format is 'emailaddress - agentid'.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorIPQuery.User
member.summary: DO NOT INCLUDE THIS FIELD IT IS AUTO GENERATED BY API.

member.name: T:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo
member.summary: This is a class that respresents the data for a host. In order for the data to be userful to a user Do not! anonymise any of the fields in the class.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.MonitorPingInfoID
member.summary: The ID used to identify this MonitorPingInfo object.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.DataSetID
member.summary: The Data set id that this host data is contained within.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.Status
member.summary: The current or last status of the host. Taken from monitorStatus.Message.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.Host
member.summary: The host name. This is the same as the Address.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.Address
member.summary: host address.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.Port
member.summary: the port used if not the default for this type of end point and host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.Username
member.summary: Username for host authentication.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.Password
member.summary: Password for host authentication.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.EndPointType
member.summary: The endpoint type. Endpoint types are: quantum is a quantum safe encryption test, http is a website ping, https is an SSL certificate check, httphtml is a website HTML load, icmp is a host ping, dns is a DNS lookup, smtp is an email server helo message confirmation, rawconnect is a low-level raw socket connection, nmap is a nmap service scan of the host, nmapvuln is a nmap vulnerability scan of the host and crawlsite performs a simulated user crawl of the site that generates site traffic using chrome browser.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.PacketsRecieved
member.summary: The total number of host up or event success for this host in this data set.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.PacketsLost
member.summary: The total number of host down or event failed for the host in this data set.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.PacketsLostPercentage
member.summary: The percentage of host down or event failed for the host in this data set.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.RoundTripTimeMaximum
member.summary: The maximum response time of the host in this data set.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.RoundTripTimeAverage
member.summary: Average response time for this host in this data set.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.RoundTripTimeTotal
member.summary: Total of all the response times for all packets sent to this host in this data set.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.PacketsSent
member.summary: Total number of packets sent in this data set for the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.AppID
member.summary: The Monitoring agent ID. For internet monitors this can be 1 for agent located at London - UK , 2 for Kansas - USA, 3 for Berlin - Germany. If it is a local agent then the AppID will be the UserInfo.UserID .

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.DateStarted
member.summary: At which UTC time was this data set started.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.DateEnded
member.summary: At which UTC time does this data set end.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.MonitorStatus
member.summary: Current or last Status of the host. If the host is down then monitorStatus.Isup = false . If Alert if flagged monitorStatus.AlertFlag = true. If Alert has been sent monitorStatus.AlertSent = true.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.PingInfos
member.summary: A list of PingInfo data for this host. Contains response times and IsUp for each monitor event.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.AddUserEmail
member.summary: The email address to which to send alerts for this host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.IsEmailVerified
member.summary: Is the email address to set alerts to for this host verified.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.MessageForUser
member.summary: This message should be displayed to the user. It will contain addtional information about the host.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.IsArchived
member.summary: Has the response data been archived for this MonitorPingInfo.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfo.AgentLocation
member.summary: The location of the monitoring agent for this host.

member.name: T:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfoQuery
member.summary: Query parameters for retrieving Host monitoring data. ONLY USE THIS QUERY FOR RETRIEVING HOST MONITORING DATA NOT HOST CONFIG. Only none null fields are used in query.

members.member: This field is Required .The prompt that was entered by the user. The backend will use this to assist in creating a useful reponse for the user.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfoQuery.DataSetId
member.summary: DataSetIs for selecting MonitorPingInfos. Dont set this if I date range is set. DataSetID=0 is the current running monitor data set.

member.summary: MonitorPingInfo.ID

member.summary: Host config data is contained in MonitorIP. This is the ID field for a MonitorIP.

member.summary: Is this host enabled.

member.summary: The port the host is using.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfoQuery.EndPointType
member.summary: The end point type. Example : http is a website ping, https is a ssl certificate check, httphtml is a website html load, icmp is a host ping, dns is a dns lookup, smtp is a email server helo message confirmation, quantum is a quantum safe encryption test.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfoQuery.AlertSent
member.summary: Has a host down alert been sent for this host since the last alert reset.

member.summary: Has a host down Alert been flagged for this host since the last alert reset.

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfoQuery.AgentLocation

member.name: P:NetworkMonitor.Objects.MonitorPingInfoQuery.DateStart
member.summary: The UTC start time to query from. When used with DateEnd this gives a range of times to filter on. Note input is assumed to be UTC.

member.summary: The UTC end time to query to.
